bug.short_desc: [Progress] msg in ProgressMonitor was truncated on redflag linux

long_desc.thetext: on RedFlag linux (locale is zh_CN.18030), noticed the message displayed in ProgressMonitor was truncated.

Created an attachment (id=48373) truncated msg in ProgressMonitor
screen shot of truncated msg in ProgressMonitor
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 144765 ***

bug.short_desc: Problems with Eclipse after intalling the web toolkit (wtp)

long_desc.thetext:
Hi all, i hope this is the correct forum to post this. i have a problem with eclipse ever since i installed the new webtoolkit i'm working with version 3.2 with wtp. the problem is i can't save resources or exit in an orderly fashion. i get the following error when trying to save: Problems occurred while trying to save the state of the workbench. Internal Error
and when trying to quit: Problems occurred while trying to save the state of the workbench. Internal Error org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.HistoryStore2.<init>(Lorg/eclipse/core/internal/resources/Workspace;Lorg/eclipse/core/runtime/IPath;I)V
The log file is quoted below:

Hi Elad,
Looking at the stack trace below, it doesn't seem to be WTP related. I have a couple questions for you.
1. How did u install WTP? Via update manager or used the zip file? Did you install the WTP pre-reqs?
2. If you create a new workspace and close it down immediately, do you see the same internal error?

I have installed eclipse 3.2 through the zip file. I've also installed WST, J2EE, and EMF projects. I checked through update manager for any updates and it seems that the config. is up to date. So doesn't seem to be a pre-req issue. Any idea how to fix this issue? Thanks.
Mahdad
(In reply to comment #1) > Hi Elad, > > Looking at the stack trace below, it doesn't seem to be WTP related. I have a > couple questions for you. > > 1. How did u install WTP? Via update manager or used the zip file? Did you > install the WTP pre-reqs? > > 2. If you create a new workspace and close it down immediately, do you see the > same internal error? >

Mahdad, Did you by chance unzip 3.2 over an existing 3.1 installation? That, or something similar, are the most likely causes for the NoClassDefFoundErrors in your log. You're also missing the GEF prereq.

I think, given Nitin's observation in comment #3 we can close this.
That is, it appears 3.1 and 3.2 plugins are being mixed (which is not supported) and some pre-reqs for GEF are missing.
My advice is to start with a fresh install, perhaps using "Callisto". http://www.eclipse.org/callisto/
Closing as invalid.

bug.short_desc: maxOccurs="1" doesn't generate a warning or restriction in plugin.xml

long_desc.thetext:
In the org.eclipse.ui.commands extension point, <command/> is defined to only have one <defaultHandler/>
[... snip ...] <sequence> <element ref="defaultHandler" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <element ref="state" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <element ref="commandParameter" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </sequence>
The PDE editor allows you to add <defaultHandler/> multiple times below <command/>, and when the plugin.xml is saved it doesn't generate a warning.
PW
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 116939 ***

bug.short_desc: MeasureItem ignores width

long_desc.thetext:
Version: 3.3.0 Build id: N20060817-0010
When I adjust the widths of a table using MeasureItem with width I give i ignored.
I will attach an example. on Line 298 play around with the rectangle passed on MeasureItem - the width will not adjust but the height will
Created an attachment (id=48375) Example showing the measure issue

Created an attachment (id=48398) Updated version
We are also getting a width of 0 in the event that we get back from PaintItem. Here is am example that shows that. Look at the drawFlag method - it draws nothing because of the width problem currently.

Unless I misunderstand, I don't think the issue in comment 0 is a bug. Since the table has columns, the column widths dictate the cell widths unless TableColumn.pack() is invoked.
I see the PaintItem's event.width == 0. Moving to SN to investigate this.

bug.short_desc: Dynamic discover code assumes an incorrect project to place the discovered node

long_desc.thetext:
In the PIProcessListener.peerWaiting code, when the project location (or container) is determined TPTP assumes that the container is always at the root of the project (or the root project where the monitor is located). This is incorrect.
The dynamically discovered node should not always be placed at teh root of the project because sometimes monitors are created in subfolders in the project, and therefore, the dynamically discovered node should also be placed in the same subfolder as its parent monitor.
I will attach a patch for this fix. We need this in a consuming product that is using tptp 4.2.1.

Created an attachment (id=48379) Patch #1
Patch to determine the project/container location for the dynamically discovered node rather than assuming the top level project folder is where the dynamic node is to be placed.
Approved by Project Lead, pending PMC approval.
fixed in both 4.2.1 and HEAD
Closing.

bug.short_desc: Eclipse busyloops in gtk.OS._pango_layout_get_iter

long_desc.thetext:
Eclipse just started suddenly eating 100% cpu. Most propably it's the main thread.
I'm running: Sun JVM 5.0_08 official eclipse 3.2 x86 gtk release Fedora Core 5 with latest updates: gtk2-2.8.20-1 pango-1.12.3-1
I took 20 thread dumps within a minute, some very close to each other, and they were all byte-exact. This indicates to me that the busy loop is fully inside the native code as otherwise in all propability one of the threads would have even a slightly different thread dump.

bug.short_desc: Allow users to select save options in generated editor

long_desc.thetext:
Please provide a mechanism (e.g. prompt to select in a dialog) in the generated editor that allows users to specify which save options are used when saving a resource. Obviously only certain options would make sense; some obvious ones are
XMLResource.OPTION_FORMATTED XMLResource.OPTION_LINE_WIDTH XMLResource.OPTION_SAVE_TYPE_INFORMATION

It might be valueable to allow the user to decide the kind of resource references. I like to have an option XMLResource.OPTION_URI_FORMAT (platformResource, pathRelative[default] and pathAbsolute) available.

How about putting this options on editor properties page in Window/Preferences? I am working on the page, that will contain listed options, whole feature will be possible to disable from genmodel properties. This will generally provide a place for more editor-oriented options. Let me know if you have a different ideas.

Created an attachment (id=58842) editor preferences patch
I appreciate all your comments on the patch.
It adds org.eclipse.ui.preferencePages extension to generated editor plugin.xml. No new plug-in dependencies are added.
Editor is modified in two major places: 1. just before saving Resource to XML, options map is created from preference store: Editor.doSaveAs().new WorkspaceModifyOperation(){ getOptions() } 2. new PreferencePage class is added in editor plugin.
Preference page subclasses FieldEditorPreferencePage so it's easy to add new options with minimum effort now.
Things missing in the patch: - switching wether preferences should be generated or not, from genmodel properties

Created an attachment (id=58890) Updates to your patch
Jacek,
This looks very cool. I never even thought about using preferences. Your patch seemed to have org.eclipse.emf checked out as project, but we normally check out the things under "plugins" as projects, so it was a little bit hard to apply the patch. The patch I've attached should be easier for us to work with and fixes a few minor problems that I noticed.

Jacek,
Thanks for the work on this! It's off to a great start. You've followed our patterns and added the new artifact to the generator almost perfectly. I think using a preference page for this was a really good idea, too, and it's very nice to see how easy it is.
One thing that I think needs some more thought is how best to organize these preferences pages. It seems nasty to dump them at the top level, when other preferences are nicely organized into hierarchies. I imagine that, once you generate a few of them (and we will, just for our included and sample editors), it would get to be a bit of a mess.
My first thought was to put them under General > Editors, but looking at what's there, it doesn't really seem like the right place. Indeed, this is more about the serialization format than the editor, itself. Maybe an XMI category would make sense? Or, if the intent is that most people would add other, non-save related options, maybe not.
Ed also suggested to me that it might make sense to have some kind of cascading arrangement, where you could have defaults for all EMF XMI, and then overrides for each particular model.
Also, instead of generating the full preference page class each time, it might be good to have a framework class with all the basic options. The generated class could extend that, allowing people to modify it as desired.
I'd like to chat with Marcelo about all this when he's back from vacation, and see what he thinks. I'd also be most interested in your thoughts.

(In reply to comment #5) > One thing that I think needs some more thought is how best to organize these > preferences pages.
Right, I've started from the point, that the editor is simple and simple preferences will suit best :) But for better user experience, preferences should be accessible from two points: - "Sample Ecore Editor" menu - because there are similar options, like Load Model, Show Properties. - Preferences - because what we're talking about are preferences for saving documents in the editor. and user knows that preferences are in preferences :)
> My first thought was to put them under General > Editors, but looking at what's > there, it doesn't really seem like the right place. Indeed, this is more about > the serialization format than the editor, itself. Maybe an XMI category would > make sense? Or, if the intent is that most people would add other, non-save > related options, maybe not.
Good point, but I'm also not sure if it will be common for users, that Editor plug-in has "XMI" menu. They may come one day and ask "I can't save my XML properly, they are saved differently in simple editor than when i do this by hand." So maybe it would be better idea, to clearly mark that preferences belong to editor, and make them like this:
+Ecore editor +- SimpleEditor1 +- SimpleEditor2 ...
but it would be perfect if a developer could customize through the plug-in.properties to have this:
+Ecore editor +- SimpleEditor1 +Topnotch RCP Editor +- Editor2 // (former SimpleEditor1)
> Ed also suggested to me that it might make sense to have some kind of cascading > arrangement, where you could have defaults for all EMF XMI, and then overrides > for each particular model.
agree, and top category (either "XMI", "Ecore editor", or else) would be best place to put them.
> Also, instead of generating the full preference page class each time, it might > be good to have a framework class with all the basic options. The generated > class could extend that, allowing people to modify it as desired.
yes it's good idea, but i am not sure if there is much to subclass. Right now generated preference page is based on FieldEditorPreferencePage, a framework class for FieldEditor preference pages, so it's very simple. I am not sure what kind of modification do you mean, or in other words, what is generic to all editors properties pages, and what is specific to every one of them. Do you mean a generic class like this:
GenericPreferencePage { +GenericPreferencePage(IPreferenceStore) // store is plug-in specific +addSaveDoctypeOption() +addSetFormattedOption() +addSetPreferedWidthOption() ...// other options +init() // default impl. -getString() // helper for all those addXXXOption() }
and then custom implementation calls super(SpecificStore) and adds desired options. The addXXXOption() methods will be two-liners so I am not sure if it's all worth it, but there are also good sides, like the fact that developer will not have to guess what is the appropriate Preference key for certain option. Right now options are very XMLResource oriented.
> I'd like to chat with Marcelo about all this when he's back from vacation, and > see what he thinks. I'd also be most interested in your thoughts.
yes, I will also try to update the patch to cover all the points we already agree.
ahh, it's 2 months! but i'm back on the issue and will update you soon.

Created an attachment (id=67674) patch with preferences hierarchy
updated patch provides default preference page "XMI Editors Preferences" and is a container for specific editors preference pages.
contribution details: 1. adds new generated class to .editor - PreferencePage. It subclasses common GenericEditPreferencePage 2. minor modifications to generated editor, so it reads preferences using two new methods: getPreferences(), getStore() 3. adds new package org.eclipse.emf.edit.ui.preferences to emf.edit.ui: two new classes: GenericEditPreferencePage - super class for all preference classes in EMF.Editor. DefaultEditPreferencePage - Default preferences page (those "XMI Editors Preferences"). So if emf.edit.ui is available, this page would show up in Preferences.
Options available in preference pages are: XMLResource.OPTION_SAVE_TYPE_INFORMATION XMLResource.OPTION_SAVE_DOCTYPE XMLResource.OPTION_FORMATTED XMLResource.OPTION_LINE_WIDTH This is for start, any other can be added easily after preference mechanism is approved.
My personal concern: i had to add dependency to org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi in emf.edit.ui, to make XMLResource.OPTION_* available. If it's not ok, they should be defined separately in emf.edit.ui.

Dave, how can i ease your work on my patch?
I think it would be good to add a switch in genmodel to enable/disable preferences, so everybody could choose if they want it or not.

Created an attachment (id=68645) Some tweaks to Jacek's patch
Jacek,
First off, I should let you know that it's too late in the cycle to add new UI or other major functionality to EMF 2.3. So, this will have to go into next year's release, 2.4.
I've looked carefully at your patch. We're making progress, but there's still some way to go. As I was looking over it and playing with it, I made a few small changes, like applying standard EMF code formatting and (mostly) resolving a naming inconsistency with the platform (switching "preferences" to "preference").
I made a few slightly more substantive changes, too. I switched DefaultEditPreferencePage to use the preference store from its own plug-in, instead of from platform.ui. It seems quite wrong to use someone else's preference store for one's own preferences, though I could be mistaken about this. Also, I noticed that the mere existence of these preferences were causing non-default options to be used. So, I made sure that GenericEditPreferencePage sets the correct details. I'm not sure if this is the best way to do things, but something like this must be done. I also made GenericEditPreferencePage set the field labels if unspecified, and I wonder whether specific labels even need to be generated for each model-specific page. When would they ever need to be different from the default?
One big thing that still needs to worked out is the fallback behaviour. Since it's now always setting default, it should never fall back to what is set on the DefaultEditPreferencePage. And I'm convinced that this is an improvement. You can't look individually at preferences that have no notion of being unset and decide whether to fall back or not. What I think we should have is a single checkbox on the generated preference pages that enables the fallback behaviour -- something analogous to the "Enable project specific settings" option on the Java Compiler project properties. A hyperlink to the fallback page would be good, too.
I was discussing all this with Marcelo, too, and one thing we thought about was that people may very well want to move the generated preference page out from under the EMF one, and indeed, use capabilities to hide the global EMF page(s). So, having a hyperlink back to it, if it isn't hidden, would seem most helpful.
Unfortunately, this all connects with broader questions about how else we might use preferences in EMF. If we are able to address EMF usability in the next cycle, as we would like, we might see more EMF preferences, so where your default page and the generated pages fit in would definitely be affected. That said, if you want to continue to work on this now, I'm happy with continuing the current layout of the generated pages nested under one for the default. "EMF Serialization" seems a better label than "XMI Editors Preferences", though I am hesitant to think too much about names before we better nail down how things will be organized.
Another issue Marcelo mentioned, which I think is a good point, is that it would be nicer, rather than just using these options in the editor, to generate a resource factory and resource that use them directly into the model plug-in. That way, the same options would be used universally, including when the instance is first created using the wizard, and in any other tool that may be written. The tricky thing here is that the preference are only available in a UI plug-in, but the model plug-in is non-UI. Marcelo suggested that it might be possible to capture this information from the preferences in metadata and look at that when initializing the resource in the generated resource factory. Maybe there's a more conventional way of addressing this kind of problem, so it seems to be something that could use some investigation.
Finally, I'd better address the two questions you raised. Yes, I definitely think a genmodel option would be good. We may want to consider having it false by default, too, so as to avoid cluttering the preferences with identical, unused pages. As for the dependency on the ecore.xmi plug-in, I don't personally see that as a major issue, but if others do (or if our switch to fine-grained features made it an issue), I would think that duplicating the constants would be fine, too.
Dave, thanks for detailed comments! sure I will continue work, maybe it's even better there's no rush. I'll follow up with comments as soon as I update patch.

bug.short_desc: XMI-Import: handling of 'negligently' encoded MultiplicityElements

long_desc.thetext: The XMI-Importer should try to recognize lower/upperValues if they provide valid integer/unlimitedNatural values (for example "*" encoded as LiteralString). Recognized values should be transformed into a correct representation according to the UML2.1-Specification.
The changes have been committed to CVS.

bug.short_desc: GMF does not respect the flyout palette preferences

long_desc.thetext:
There are two problems here. The first is that the default FlyoutPreferences used by DiagramEditorWithFlyoutPalette doesn't actually save any of the preference changes. So, if I were to move the palette or change its size, those changes don't get saved, and the default values are used again upon restart. This problem was reproduced in the GMF examples.
The second problem is that there's no easy way to override that. DEWFP doesn't provide any way to change the FlyoutPreferences or their defaults. Is it possible to add a protected getPalettePreferences() method to that class (like in GEF's GraphicalEditorWithFlyoutPalette), that can then return something by default?
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 117917 ***

bug.short_desc: GMF tool models migration usecase - narrowing containment EReference type

long_desc.thetext:
Allows safe replacing of EReference.eType by its super-type ensuring that possibly missing (xsi:type/xmi:type) in older serialized contents is provided at load time.
Remark: The type-info is by default skipped on XMLSave in case that referenced object is of reference type. However, it can be enforced by XMLResource.OPTION_SAVE_TYPE_INFORMATION.
In case the type-info is missing the previous reference type element is instantiated as the contained object.
Committed.

Target Milestone is 1.0, which is the expected version of OpenUP/Basic when we will release the fix to the issue. Later, as iterations are planned, we assign the individual issues to 1.0 M1, 1.0 M2 and so on. For now, we are keeping bugs assigned to "Content" component, but it may be moved to "OpenUP" component (waiting response from Eclipse webmaster on how to create that component).
And sorry if these changes create an avalanche of emails :-)
Cheers,
Ricardo.

There has been no progress in this bug for a few months. I've checked CVS and the changes have been incorporated into the library, but the bug never updated. I'm changing to Resolved Fixed. Brian, would you please verify and close it? Thanks.
As per comment #8, I'm closing this bug.

bug.short_desc: Allow dynamic page sets to be associated with facet actions

long_desc.thetext:
Currently, you can only associate a static sequence of wizard pages with a facet action. This is limiting in some circumstances. There are usecases where it desirable to dynamically change the number of pages used. For instance, input on the one page controlling the visibility of subsequent pages. It would also be useful to be able to show no pages for a facet action based on some dynamic condition.
To satisfy this requirement, a notion of a page set should be added to the faceted project framework. The page set would get registered with the framework and can dynamically provide the pages instead of having the pages be registered statically.
*** Bug 198125 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

bug.short_desc: [Browser] Browser setURL() does not support jarred resources

long_desc.thetext: The WTP internet cache makes use of the SWT browser widget to display licenses. These licenses may be retrieved remotely or stored locally in plug-ins. When I specify a URL of a jarred resource, such as jar:file:D:\eclipse3.2\eclipse\plugins\someplugins.jar!/license/license.html, to the browser widget it is unable to display the jarred HTML file. The setURL method still returns true but I see a page stating that the page cannot be displayed.
Created an attachment (id=48393) Screenshot of the license dialog with the error page due to the jarred HTML file.
I remember way, way, way back (2 years) that there was some reason that this would never work. It's quite possible I am remembering something else. Christophe had the details.

Probably for the same reason this URL will not work in the browser....it's not supported.
Why it is returning true....seems like it would be an issue.
There was something about people expecting to get URL's from JAR's ... probably unrelated.

The jar: protocol is not supported by IE, which is the Browser's native renderer on win32. This protocol is supported by mozilla/firefox, and I've confirmed that creating a SWT.MOZILLA-style Browser will show an html file within a jar.
Closing as WONTFIX since the Browser is exposing the behaviour of its native renderer.

OK. I created a workaround a long time ago. I would like to hide this inconsistency from users but if the Eclipse line wrt browsers is to expose their behaviour as is I can accept that.
Closing.

bug.short_desc: EPIC Plugin Rating

long_desc.thetext:
Summary: The EPIC Council has proposed an improvement to the plugin rating system. The goals and the proposed action items are outlined below.
Goals for improving the rating system: 1. Decrease fraudulent rating 2. Increase transparency 3. Increase the perceived credibility of the rating system 4. Increase participation.
Proposed action items as of August 1: A working group from the Council made the following suggestions for initial improvements to the rating system:
1. Stop proxy voting. Proxy votes would cease to count towards total but the occurrence of an attempt would be visible on the plug-in rating page. 2. Publish information on how the rating system works and how it protects against fraud. 3. Require an email address to rank different from a full registration. 4. Remove outside rating thus removing a possibility of a rating to default to 10. Instead provide and promote the option for web sites to link to a plugins rating page on EPIC
Other courses of action: 1. Require registration to vote. This would replace 1-3. The working group decided not to propose this action as a first step as it might overly reduce participation. However, this is still a viable alternative.
2. Suggestions were made by Eric Clayberg at Instantiations. Here are several to consider:
Increase the minimum number of votes to a higher fixed number of 50 or a number relative to the plugin with the most votes (such as 1-2% of 4000) Restrict the amount of low votes from a single IP address within a certain time frame. Increase the number of top-rated plugins displayed to more than the current 10. Weighted voting a registered vote would count for more. Ability to respond to voters comments

For each comment/vote add the version of the plugin the vote was casted against. A lot of times comments are outdated and give a wrong impression for a plugin. The date alone is not enough to see against which version this vote/comment was casted.

bug.short_desc: improve performance of scheduling a large number of tasks

long_desc.thetext:
"Schedule for..." actions are very slow. It is very easy to reproduce by seleccting 30..50 issues from some query and run schedule/clean action from the popup menu.
First of all it runs in the UI thread which is really bad idea, but even then it takes about 20..30 seconds to complete for me...

It is not exactly related to this issue, but I just find out that when task is created for query hit, the whole task list is immediately saved. So, when you mark 2000 hits as read or completed task list will be saved 2000 times. Not to mention that on each save it will iterate trough the whole task list.
Eugene, your improvements to saving should have at least partially resolved this?

Just verified. Now it does not block ide if you call schedule or mark read/unread on a large pile of tasks. Though Task List flickering is quite noticeable if you do that on a few hundreds of tasks and that kept going for good 5..10 minutes and very noticeable slow down the whole ide.

bug.short_desc: [KeyBindings] Contexts for key bindings do not work

long_desc.thetext: This is not critical (i.e. crash, loss of data).

(In reply to comment #0) > In my view class, I activate the context I created for my F1 action: > > IContextService contextService = (IContextService) PlatformUI > .getWorkbench().getService(IContextService.class); > IContextActivation activation = contextService > .activateContext("KeyAccPrj.context1");
Just as an aside, this context will always be active, and is not tied to a particular parent context.
Why not use getViewSite().getService(*) as in your IHandlerService?
PW

(In reply to comment #2) It's true, I have tried getViewSite().getService(*) as well, it doesn't make a difference though.
There are 2 other contexts active in my view: "org.eclipse.ui.contexts.dialogAndWindow" and "org.eclipse.ui.contexts.window" as I could see calling the contextService.getActiveContextIds() method.
I also set the parent for my context with each of the above contexts, hoping that my context will override the parent context. Same result, both the Eclipse F1 help is displayed and my action run.
I also tried to deactivate the other active contexts in my view before activating my context: contextService.deactivateContexts(contextService.getActiveContextIds());
In this case I got an exception when I open my view: java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.String at org.eclipse.ui.internal.contexts.SlaveContextService.deactivateContexts(SlaveContextService.java:225) at keyaccprj.views.SampleView.createPartControl(SampleView.java:145)
Am I allowed to do this? Do I have to activate/deactivate directly the contexts?
Conform to the documentation: "When a context is associated with a key binding, the key binding will only be active when the user is in that context."
So, I assume I should have only one context active in my view to get the intended behaviour.
I also found this bug related to the key bindings problem: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=154130

(In reply to comment #3) > Am I allowed to do this? Do I have to activate/deactivate directly the > contexts?
No, you can only deactivate contexts that you activate yourself.
> Conform to the documentation: > "When a context is associated with a key binding, the key binding will only be > active when the user is in that context." > > So, I assume I should have only one context active in my view to get the > intended behaviour.
It's OK to have multiple contexts active ... for normal operation of your context in your view, you would have at least "org.eclipse.ui.contexts.dialogAndWindow", "org.eclipse.ui.contexts.window", and "KeyAccPrj.context1" active.
It could be a key binding conflict ... if Help is defined as F1 in "org.eclipse.ui.contexts.dialogAndWindow" and your command is defined as F1 in "KeyAccPrj.context1" then you would potentially have a keybinding conflict.
1) can you check the keybindings? Go to Window>Preferences>General>Keys. See if Help and your command both show up against F1.
2) you can run with some tracing to let me know what it's doing, a la http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Platform_UI_Command_Design#Tracing_Option
Your debug options would be: org.eclipse.ui/debug=true org.eclipse.ui/trace/keyBindings=true org.eclipse.ui/trace/keyBindings.verbose=true org.eclipse.ui/trace/contexts=true org.eclipse.ui/trace/contexts.verbose=true
When you press F1, what does KEYS report?
Thanx, PW
Created an attachment (id=48440) Keys

For the key bindings, please see the attachement. There is no key conflict. However, somehow the Eclipse help is displayed. Is it possible to be displayed outside of the commands/key bindings framework?
I have problems setting the debug configuration that you asked me for. I will try again tomorrow and get back to you.
I would like to emphasize that I need to have specific behaviour for the functional keys(including F1) in a view. I want to use the functional keys for my own actions. Is there any way to override the behaviour for these keys defined by Eclipse/other plugins only for my view? My understanding was that contexts would be a way to do this. You pointed out in the last comment that at least 3 contexts would be available at the same time.
Isnt't the whole commands/key binding API the way to avoid conflicts between key accelerators defined by different plugins allowing certain key accelerators to be available in a specific context?
Thank you.

(In reply to comment #6) > For the key bindings, please see the attachement. There is no key conflict. > However, somehow the Eclipse help is displayed. Is it possible to be displayed > outside of the commands/key bindings framework?
I'll have a look (and run some tests) this morning.
> Isnt't the whole commands/key binding API the way to avoid conflicts between > key accelerators defined by different plugins allowing certain key accelerators > to be available in a specific context? >
Actually, it's hierarchical Schemes that can allow keybindings to be overridden. For example, the emacs scheme is a child of the default scheme (org.eclipse.ui.defaultAcceleratorConfiguration). It inherits all of the default keybindings, but emacs keybindings take precedence over default keybindings.
Contexts are a way to manage keybindings within a scheme, it's true, but for example, a keybinding defined in dialogsAndWindows will always be defined and that makes it extremely hard to override.
PW

When I run your test with my example: <extension point="org.eclipse.ui.bindings"> <key commandId="z.ex.view.keybindings.remove.cmd" contextId="z.ex.view.keybindings.remove.context" schemeId="org.eclipse.ui.defaultAcceleratorConfiguration" sequence="F1"> </key> </extension> <extension point="org.eclipse.ui.contexts"> <context description="Remove the Taco Context" id="z.ex.view.keybindings.remove.context" name="RemoveContext" parentId="org.eclipse.ui.contexts.window"> </context> </extension>
And my view createPartControl(*) has: IContextService contextService = (IContextService) getSite() .getService(IContextService.class); contextService.activateContext("z.ex.view.keybindings.remove.context");
My F1 does nothing in the Outline View or Package Explorer: CONTEXTS >>> [org.eclipse.ui.contexts.dialogAndWindow, org.eclipse.ui.contexts.window] BINDINGS >>> Cache hit KEYS >>> Listener.handleEvent(type = KeyDown, stateMask = 0x0, keyCode = 0x100000a, time = 79174170, character = 0x0) KEYS >>> WorkbenchKeyboard.press(potentialKeyStrokes = [F1, ])
but works when my view is active: CONTEXTS >>> [org.eclipse.ui.contexts.dialogAndWindow, z.ex.view.keybindings.remove.context, org.eclipse.ui.contexts.window] BINDINGS >>> Cache hit KEYS >>> Listener.handleEvent(type = KeyDown, stateMask = 0x0, keyCode = 0x100000a, time = 79176990, character = 0x0) KEYS >>> WorkbenchKeyboard.press(potentialKeyStrokes = [F1, ]) KEYS >>> WorkbenchKeyboard.executeCommand(commandId = 'z.ex.view.keybindings.remove.cmd', parameters = {})

PW

KEYS >>> Listener.handleEvent(type = KeyDown, stateMask = 0x0, keyCode = 0x100000a, time = 173584765, character = 0x0) KEYS >>> WorkbenchKeyboard.press(potentialKeyStrokes = [F1, ]) KEYS >>> WorkbenchKeyboard.executeCommand(commandId = 'KeyAccPrj.command1', parameters = {}) Sample... action!

bug.short_desc: Bugzilla pane is empty when retrieving a task from Bugzilla using SSH/Tunneling

long_desc.thetext:
When using forwarded ports through SSH, with a configured Task Repository URL such as bugzilla:http://localhost:8889/bugs, the Bugzilla pane reports:
"Could not download task data, possibly due to timeout or connectivity problem. Please check connection and try again."
Note that querying this repository w/ the above URL works.
Tony, am I correct in saying that queries from Mylar (for example Search > Repository Task) work but you are unable to load the resulting hits? Can you confirm that urlbase is set on your repository?

Hey Robert - yes, you are correct in saying that. What exactly are you referring to when you say urlbase? Is this something I can set inside of Task Repository Settings, or is this set somewhere else?

urlbase is a property set in the bugzilla server settings. If the repository isn't your own you probably will not have access to this. One way of checking is to point your browser to <your-repository-url>/config.cgi?ctype=rdf (then view the page source) and check that the rdf:about attribute is not blank (ie. <bz:installation rdf:about="AddressOfRepositoryHere?">).
If there is a proper repository url there then we will need to investigate further.

<bz:installation rdf:about="http://bugs.tuvox.com/"> is what's there.
This machine is behind the company firewall, so I'm using SSH and the above URL to access this repo. Should this be a problem?
One more note - if I VPN in and use http://bugs.tuvox.com, I don't encounter this issue.

A few thoughts: - Have you tired redirection using something like http://localhost:8889/bugs:sshtunnelportnumberhere or is this not how your ssh client works? - Try adding the trailing / to the url you enter in the task repository config
Sorry but I haven't tried a port forwarding configuration so am just throughing ideas out there. :) Let me know if either of these ideas work and if not, perhaps you can let me know what ssh product you are using and I can try to reproduce the environment here?

The trailing / is automatically removed once I close the Task Repository Settings Dialog.
I'm using SSH Secure Shell 3.2.9.
I'll have to set up a similar environment here and test. I'll get back to you asap.
I've tested port forwarding here using both SecureCRT and SSH Secure Shell 3.2.9 and can't reproduce the error with either. Are there any hints in the error log?

Could you give me some details about the Bugzilla repository itself such as: -Is it customized? -What version is it? -Are you able to retrieve bugs as xml? (I've added an entry about this to the faq http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_FAQ#Bugzilla_Connector_troubleshooting)
- Is the repository using LDAP authentication?
No to both anything useful in the error log and LDAP auth. Did you use a similar url when you tested the port forwarding w/ SSH?
I tried http://localhost:8889/myrepository with 8889 redirected to 80 on the remote host without problems. I also tried with https without failure.
Do you have a test SSH account in your environment so I can try connecting to it? It would be interesting to see if the problem is with the setup of my company's repo.
There is now a guest account on mylar.eclipse.org for you to test against. I'll send you the password and details over email.

I have no issues when using this test environment that you've setup. The Bugzilla Pane/View is working as expected. This really only leaves the Bugzilla instance/config at fault. Any other ideas? If I get access to this Bugzilla instance, are there any logs or settings that I should check?

I must admit I'm running out of ideas here. The only observation I can make is that if it works over VPN but not over an ssh tunnel then the trouble must be the tunnel, no? As far as the bugzilla config goes you could check that: - it is version 2.18 or higher - check to ensure that the parameter regarding use of ssl is in fact set to 'never'
But I'm still convinced this is something to do with the tunnelling. :)

So here's the setup. This machine's Internet addressable IP is 64.221.252.202 / dev02.tuvox.com. Inside the firewall/intranet, the machine is aliased as bugs.tuvox.com with IP 10.232.10.10. The url for bugzilla is http://bugs.tuvox.com/bugs.
I've tried all the combinations in terms of specifying machine name/url in the tunneling and ssh options. I think this is the difference in your environment. The IP/Machine Name that I SSH to is not (and cannot) be the same as the IP/Machine Name specified in the tunneling. Can you confirm that both those are the same in your test env?

Yes, the test server (mylar.eclipse.org) you are connecting to over ssh is the same (virtual) server that hosts the bugzilla server.
So when tunneled, can you query and download bug reports via the web ui without failure?
I can't help but wonder if apache is doing name based virtual hosting, but that doesn't make sense because you said you can retrieve query results...

I actually did set both settings to dev02.tuvox.com (both for the destination host for SSH and then the destination host for the tunnelling), and it still doesn't work. What's so frustrating is that I don't get any more detail then just: "Could not download task data, possibly due to timeout or connectivity problem. Please check connection and try again." I guess if I grabbed the source and set some breakpoints...
Does mylar.eclipse.org have other aliases? Is this host name specified in the Bugzilla install? My suspicion is still with the multiple names (whether configured via Apache or the OS) this machine is serving Bugzilla through.
I'll try adding some more debug output and then ask Mik to cut a dev build for you to try out - perhaps then we'll be able to track this down.

I just noticed that in comment#18 you mention that the url for bugzilla is http://bugs.tuvox.com/bugs but in comment#4 the config you provide is pointing to http://bugs.tuvox.com/. This could be the problem, could you double check these?

This is the problem I think. When VPN'd in, both of the above urls will get to the start page in the browser. However, when tunnelling, only http://localhost:8889/bugs will work. But the Bugzilla url base is set to http://bugs.tuvox.com. Not sure what's the best way to resolve this one

I think the only resolution is to get the sysadmin to set the urlbase on the bugzilla server to the correct url http://bugs.tuvox.com/bugs. My guess is that there is some redirect happening for http://bugs.tuvox.com/ that isn't happening when you are tunnelled in.
Were you able to get the urlbase updated Tony?
The change request was put in last week, and I'm looking forward to testing this sometime today. Will keep you posted.
Any luck Tony?

If you guys come up with any additional steps or caveats with connecting in tunneled mode please put them here:
http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_FAQ#Network_and_proxy_server_troubleshooting
Rob: you should also make sure that the misconfigured hostname problem is listed in the troubleshooting:
http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_FAQ#Bugzilla_Connector_troubleshooting

We didn't change the urlbase, but we did change the apache virtual mapping so that the virtual root now points to the bugzilla instance. So now I can access from my browser (when ssh'd/tunneled) to http://localhost:8889/ instead of the old http://localhost:8889/bugs. However, the problem is still there. I'm not sure what the next step is...

A version of today's dev build with additional logging info is now available from:
download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/test
You may need to give it up to 30 minutes to replicate. Version is:0.6.2.v20060922-1830
Note that this is an Eclipse 3.3M2 build, but everyting other than the automatic context test suite should work fine.

Using the dev build, here are excerpts from .log:
VPN'd AND SSH'd (works!):
!ENTRY org.eclipse.mylar.core 1 0 2006-09-22 23:40:23.940 !MESSAGE Mylar: Retrieving task data from: http://localhost:8889, source: java.lang.Class

!ENTRY org.eclipse.mylar.bugzilla 4 0 2006-09-22 23:40:12.486 !MESSAGE Report download from http://localhost:8889 failed, please see details. !STACK 0 java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketConnect(Native Method) at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.doConnect(Unknown Source) at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connectToAddress(Unknown Source) at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connect(Unknown Source) at java.net.Socket.connect(Unknown Source) at sun.net.NetworkClient.doConnect(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.openServer(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.openServer(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.parseHTTP(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(Unknown Source) at java.net.HttpURLConnection.getResponseCode(Unknown Source) at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.AbstractReportFactory.collectResults(AbstractReportFactory.java:57) at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.RepositoryReportFactory.populateReport(RepositoryReportFactory.java:44) at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaServerFacade.getBug(BugzillaServerFacade.java:97) at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaOfflineTaskHandler.downloadTaskData(BugzillaOfflineTaskHandler.java:80) at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.SynchronizeTaskJob.run(SynchronizeTaskJob.java:101) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
Just to clarify, that second scenario above "VPN'd and NOT SSH'd (still doesn't work)" did you mean "SSH'd and NOT VPN'd"?
Sorry about the confusion - you are right. It should be SSH'd and NOT VPN'd

The exception posted in comment#32 indicates that the host isn't listening on port 8889. This is very strange since you are able to query the server. I'm going to look into this further and will get back to you asap. In the mean time, could you try opening a report with your repository configured for anonymous access and see if this has some effect? Thanks.
I'll see if the admin guys will be willing to allow anon access temporarily.

Also, in the Eclipse toolbar menu go to Search > Search... > Task Search, select the repository in question and press Update Attributes from Repository. Let me know if the fields populate with values or if it remains blank.
Task Search works when I'm SSH'd and using http://localhost:8889

I spent more time on this yesterday to see if perhaps some invalid url construction was causing this upon task retrieval but again I couldn't re-produce. The only time I came remotely close to reproducing was when the web host was doing redirection which would cause a problem but you aren't seeing html 'move' related exceptions so I've hit a dead end again. You mentioned you might be willing to download the source and set a few break points, perhaps that is our next best option?
I'd be happy to do that. We can coordinate over IM?

Tony: the workspace setup instructions are here http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_Contributor_Reference#Workspace_setup
If you have any problems getting set up it would be good if you could update those. Feel free to post questions about that on this bug report in case Rob is more responsive on Bugzilla than on IM, since it's our practice to assist with debugging/configuration stuff on Bugzilla whenever possible (so that the conversations are captured for others to reuse if needed).
Tony, have you had a chance to look at this?
I have my environment all set. Want to give me the breakpoints I should set?

It looks like an exception is being thrown around line 57 in AbstractReportFactory because connection is refused. So just set a break point at line 55 where the WebClientUtil.openUrlConnection(url, proxySettings, false) call is and check that the url is sound....then we can go from there. Set the break point and then just right click on a hit and select synchronize which should exercise this code.

here's what i found. line 115 returns and we get to the finally pretyt much right away when i get a task from a repository that works (like the bugs.eclipse.org), but it takes a long time using my example, but it still gets to the finally clause...
...and then after the finally, the ConnectionExcpetion is caught inside downloadTaskData of BugzillaOfflineTaskHandler

Great. Lets just confirm that we're getting data by adding the line: System.err.println(characters); just after line 71 in the SaxBugReportContentHandler.characters(..) method. This will spit out the data (if any) we're getting back in each xml element.

I can't figure out what's going on - there are some inconsistencies in tracing through. Without ever vpn'ing in (only tunneled), I was once able to retrieve a task. I was tracing deep through the call stack, and the only thing I can figure out is that this "run" had enough time to complete the task, whereas normally, it times out.
Okay thanks Tony! I've had one other user mention similar behavior so will investigate the possibility of timeouts causing this problem.
Hey Rob - any updates?

There were some changes to task data retrieval that made it into 0.8 release. Could you give this release a shot. I still haven't been able to reproduce and therefore solve out-right though. Some more major changes are ahead for 0.9 as I'll be moving to apache's HttpClient library exclusively.

Tony, I've made some major changes in task data retrieval (switched to Apache HttpClient from java's URLConnection). I've also added http authentication to the mix. Mik will be cutting a dev build that includes these changes this afternoon. It would be great if you could test with it. I'll post the version number so you're sure to have the correct build.
There were some encoding issues in last nights build. We'll be cutting another dev build Friday evening that fixes these issues and others (targets M3).
Hi Tony, any chance you could test with the latest release (0.9)?
It's now working! And it only took 54 comments ;)
Great! Thanks for the confirmation Tony.

Wow, talk about persistence guys, nice work on all sides :) Marking this as a "greatbug" due to the trickiness (problems with java.net.URL failures), and the amount of collaboration needed to figure out that we had had to go as far as changing our authentication/connection architecture to resolve it.

bug.short_desc: [Presentations] Editor PresentationStack never gets disposed when IWorkbenchConfigurer.setSaveAndRestore(true)

long_desc.thetext:
Typically (with one workbench window,etc) a single stack is created for editors. But when you call IWorkbenchConfigurer.setSaveAndRestore(true), another editor stack is created (presumably to make it easier to restore the state). This new editor stack seems to become the current editor stack. The first editor stack that was created sticks around and is never disposed, even on shutdown.
This can be easily demonstrated by simply putting some sysout statements in the creation and disposal of a presentation (two creations, one dispose).

<bump>
Could we possibly get any attention to this bug? Originally we're just hit by resources not being disposed but now we've got listeners in our editor presentation that aren't being disposed either (because dispose is never called). It seems like it might be a pretty easy fix once its determined where the new editor stack is being created and hence where the old one should be diposed.
I'll try and get this into my plan. PW
Also see bug 122322.

bug.short_desc: GraphicsAntialiasingTab fails under both Motif and GTK

long_desc.thetext:
When selecting the GraphicsAntialiasingTab, the GraphicsExample application dies.
Steps for reproducing: - Check out org.eclipse.swt.examples from CVS - Put the attached file in your workspace under org.eclipse.swt.examples.graphics - Run the graphics example - In the tree, expand "Antialiasing" and select "Graphics"
On Motif, the following output is displayed: X connection to :0.0 broken (explicit kill or server shutdown).
On GTK, the following output is displayed: The application 'SWT' lost its connection to the display :0.0; most likely the X server was shut down or you killed/destroyed the application.
Created an attachment (id=48397) Test Case
I believe cairo is crashing cause way to many trapezoids are sent to the X server. If I reduce the numbers of arcs in the drawing it works fine.
There is not anything SWT can do to avoid this problem. I have changed the example to add less arcs to the path. Most of the arcs were clipped anyways.
75 is too many??
Actualy, it is not the number of arcs drawn, I believe it is the number of trapezoids that are needed to represent the arcs. The original code failed with 30 arcs.

Steps for reproducing: - Check out org.eclipse.swt.examples from CVS - Put the attached file in your workspace under org.eclipse.swt.examples.graphics - Run the graphics example - In the tree, expand "Image" and select "Interpolation" - Select "House" from the drop-down menu.

bug.short_desc: (Release Note)ramaster needs cleanup after crash

long_desc.thetext: Need to have documentation in the release notes for following situation: The iac(which runs from the workbench) will not function at all if an obsolete copy of /tmp/IBMRAC/ramaster exists. That is: if the workbench crashes, or is killed, and if /tmp/IBMRAC/ramaster exists at that time, the IAC will not be able to detect any agents on the system next time the workbench starts. The workaround is removing the problematic file (ramaster). The behavior seen is that no agents will be available for selection and message box details may show an internal error occurrred during "Fetching children of host". Pls assign to Samson. Thanks.
Assigning to Samson

bug.short_desc: [refactoring scripts] Refactoring History Property page showing in weird places

long_desc.thetext:

bug.short_desc: getUserData/setUserData support for Node

long_desc.thetext: We (Eclipse OHF) would like to use the methods Node.getUserData()/Node.setUserData() to cache our element identifications in our tooling. It would really save us extensive processing and would make our integration easier with WST. Unfortunately, it is not implemented for WST's internal w3c DOM implementation (org.eclipse.wst.xml.core.internal.document.NodeImpl). We would like to request this functionality as a enhancement for WST. We have created a unit tested implementation of these methods for you. Is there any chance to include these methods in a release soon?
Created an attachment (id=48405) setUserData/getUserData implementations
Attaching the unit test would help, but don't there need to be more extensive changes made so that the UserDataHandlers receive the notifications they're expecting?
Created an attachment (id=48445) Junit testcase for getUserData-setUserData

Nitin,
Thanks for the prompt response. I have attached the Junit testcase. Regarding the UserDataHandlers, you are right, I have only implemented the minimal functionality that is required for setting the handlers, making calls to them would require additional implementation whenever a Node gets cloned, imported or renamed (based on w3 spec). It seems to me that only import and clone is implemented within your implementation. I will submit patches for the classes affected.

Actually, the operations that UserDataHandler can be notified about are: NODE_CLONED using Node.cloneNode() - implemented by WST NODE_IMPORTED using Document.importNode() - implemented by WST NODE_DELETED using any delete - This may not be supported or may not be reliable in certain environments, such as Java, where the implementation has no real control over when objects are actually deleted. NODE_RENAMED using Document.renameNode() - not implemented by WST NODE_ADOPTED using Document.adoptNode() - experimental (not implemented) by WST.
I believe implementing CLONE, IMPORT would be acceptable given the rest of the implementations. Any thoughts?
Created an attachment (id=48451) patch for getUserData/setUserData
Created an attachment (id=48452) updated Junit testcase for getUserData-setUserData

I like the looks of this contribtion. Neat code, good JUnit tests.
There is one JUnit test that fails, but I'll go a head and check into HEAD for easier disposiition ... maybe its just a typo, or something ... I tried a few obvious variations, but wasnt' real sure what it was supposed to do, so, thought I'd leave to you, Balaza.

Before I forget, if/when we ever tie this into the main tests that run during a build, we'll either have to split test streams .... or something.
Now, about those notifications. Balazas, I'll consider this a "work in progress", and it "may not make it in final version" depending on how it progresses and community review. For exampple, we will need to do as much as we can to property implement according to DOM 3 spec as best we can, in its entirety. We also need to document how to use it, what it might be useful for (just briefly), and document ways we deviate from the spec, if any. As an example of one challange, I read some where from a google that "when the DOM is released [what ever that means] that delete is supposed to be sent to the user data for each node!"
Also, seems we should extend this to the HTML DOM and JSP Dom's we use. Would there be any diffrenece? We also add a "new" type, called "Comment Element" that we might want to consider.
Also, please educate me, is this 'handler notification' a whole seperate thing than DOM Events (e.g. http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-2-Events/events.html). Seems to me to be so ... but, wanted to confirm.

Thanks David for the feedback on the contribution. I will check the reason why that particular JUNIT test failed, could you please send me some description (stacktrace would do) that failed?
Regarding the implementation of the DOM3 spec, I agree it would be great to have the complete implementation for the WST. Currently, the set/getUserData implementation is incomplete because the actual WST DOM implementation is missing some of the functionalities that UserDataHandler needs to be notified of:
NODE_CLONED using Node.cloneNode() - implemented NODE_IMPORTED using Document.importNode() - implemented NODE_DELETED using any delete - Like you have mentioned, this is an interesting one, since in Java, there is no real control over when objects are actually deleted, therefore not implemented. See API: http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/org/w3c/dom/UserDataHandler.html#NODE_DELETED More on this messy req: http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-dom/2002OctDec/0117.html
NODE_RENAMED using Document.renameNode() - not implemented by WST NODE_ADOPTED using Document.adoptNode() - experimental (not implemented) by WST.
I think the patch would provide a good start to extend upon as the current DOM3 support progresses.
>Also, seems we should extend this to the HTML DOM and JSP Dom's we use. Would >there be any diffrenece? We also add a "new" type, called "Comment Element" >that we might want to consider. When new type of Node implementations are added, calling the UserDataHandlers need to be implemented similarly to the already available ones.
>Also, please educate me, is this 'handler notification' a whole seperate thing >than DOM Events (e.g. http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-2-Events/events.html). >Seems to me to be so ... but, wanted to confirm. Yes, it is different. I followed the spec I found here: http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-3-Core/core.html#UserDataHandler
Created an attachment (id=49825) stack trace from failing JUnit, testNotifyUserDataHandler2

I've realized this morning, that notifyUserDataHandlers should be 'protected', instead of public, right? I've changed it to protected in HEAD.
On "other types of Nodes", I count 23 concrete subclasses of NodeImpl (in our implementation) ... perhaps you would enjoy surveying them, making a little table on which do not have UserData implemented and and why? Or, better yet, make sure they are all implemented! With appropriate JUnit's, naturally. :) [most of them, I think could pick up "parent" behavior, except for the clonedNode part ... some, I see, do not have their own implementation of cloneNode].
Also, see Bug 156293 ... looks like you could take credit for that one too, if you choose to finish this for all types.

Created an attachment (id=49936) Junit testcase for getUserData-setUserData
Corrected JUNIT test case for UserData support.

I hope the contribution provides a good starting point for the WST team to extend upon. As an OHF committer I really do not want to venture too far beyond (JSP, HTML) the boundaries of the requirements for our project, especially since the requirements and the schedule for complete DOM3 support are unclear to me.

bug.short_desc: Improve preference filtering on multiple keywords

long_desc.thetext:
The ability to filter preference pages based on keywords entered by the user is very useful. Unfortunately it only really works on a single keyword, and not multiple keywords. Multi-keyword matches are only made against the preference categories on the left of the Preferences dialog.
For example, if you enter "tab" in the filter field you get:
-General Appearence -Editors Text Editors -Java -Code Style Formatter -Editor Typing
And if you enter "width" in the filter field you get:
-General -Editors Text Editors
But, if you enter "tab width", you get nothing, which is rather unfortunate. I would like to see one of the following:
1) Disallow spaces in the filter field. It seems that when you include a space the only mult-word matches are on the preference categories. For example, entering "Code Style" yields the "Java > Code Style" preference page.
2) Fully support multiple keywords by ANDing the search results for each keyword entered.

bug.short_desc: Content-assisted method parameters should 'tab' on comma

long_desc.thetext:
Code completion on a method name fills in stub parameter names surrounded by blue boxes. The current, highlighted parameter is replaced as you type. Pressing tab moves to the next parameter.
Bug: The comma character should also move to and highlight the next parameter.
Rationale: Commas are what actually separate the paramters and it is intuitive to type the comma between them.

bug.short_desc: region1.intersect(region2) does not behave correctly on Motif

long_desc.thetext:
When using region clipping in the GraphicsExample application, the intersect operation (intersecting two regions) does not work properly.
Steps for reproducing: - Check out org.eclipse.swt.examples from CVS - Put the attached file in your workspace under org.eclipse.swt.examples.graphics - Run the graphics example - In the tree, expand "Clipping" and select "Region Clipping" - From the drop-down menu, select "Intersect" - Problem: the intersection region includes a greater area than it is suppose to.
Created an attachment (id=48406) Test Case
The problem here is that there is no API in X to get the rectangles out of a Region so that GC can set it in the cairo graphics, so the bounding box is used instead.

bug.short_desc: The Integrated Agent Controller's preference page is poorly designed

long_desc.thetext:
There are a few design issues with the preference page:
1) Perhaps the biggest problem that it has is that it doesn't use the standard JVM setting that is configured under: Java > Installed JREs. The selected JVM is the one that it should be using as its configured Java executable. There are many mysterious discrepancies that the user may experience between running and profiling an application if two separate JVM versions are used (e.g. If IAC's JVM points to 1.4.2 and the workbench JVM points to 1.5.0, then a JUnit that uses System.getenv(...) will pass when launched in the run mode and fail when launched in profile mode)
2) Both the "Setting" and the "Environment" tab have a poor layout. The options under the two tabs are relevant but separated (e.g. the severity of the log records and the path of the log file are present under two separate tabs). It seems that it was put together quickly without any consideration to its general layout/presentation.
Set to 4.3 w/o iteration for bug triaging.
Not containable in 4.3 and retarget to 4.4. Please let me know if you have any concern.
Retarget to future due to resource limitation.

Samson,
Is there anyone else who can handle this? Again, I think it's a defect that should be contained in 4.4.
This will be reimplemented by Navid.
Updated target to match the iteration when this defect was processed

bug.short_desc: DiagramActionBarContributor.dispose should not access runtime registry

long_desc.thetext:
- Create plugin with Editor implementation inside - On runtime open editor instance - Call Bundle.uninstall() -> EditorManager.removeExtension fails with the following exception:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.InvalidRegistryObjectException: Invalid registry object at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.RegistryObjectManager.basicGetObject(RegistryObjectManager.java:271) at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.RegistryObjectManager.getObject(RegistryObjectManager.java:261) at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ConfigurationElementHandle.getConfigurationElement(ConfigurationElementHandle.java:26) at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ConfigurationElementHandle.getAttribute(ConfigurationElementHandle.java:34) at org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.common.core.service.Service$ProviderDescriptor.toString(Service.java:279) at java.lang.String.valueOf(Unknown Source) at java.lang.StringBuffer.append(Unknown Source) at org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.common.core.service.ExecutionStrategy.safeProvides(ExecutionStrategy.java:334) at org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.common.core.service.ExecutionStrategy.getUncachedProviders(ExecutionStrategy.java:259) at org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.common.core.service.Service.getProviders(Service.java:528) at org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.common.core.service.ExecutionStrategy$4.execute(ExecutionStrategy.java:183) at org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.common.core.service.Service.execute(Service.java:642) at org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.common.ui.services.action.contributionitem.ContributionItemService.execute(ContributionItemService.java:288) at org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.common.ui.services.action.contributionitem.ContributionItemService.disposeContributions(ContributionItemService.java:256) at org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.diagram.ui.parts.DiagramActionBarContributor.dispose(DiagramActionBarContributor.java:96) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorActionBars.dispose(EditorActionBars.java:148) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorManager.disposeEditorActionBars(EditorManager.java:357) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorReference.doDisposePart(EditorReference.java:250) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPartReference.dispose(WorkbenchPartReference.java:642) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.disposePart(WorkbenchPage.java:1541) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.handleDeferredEvents(WorkbenchPage.java:1311) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.deferUpdates(WorkbenchPage.java:1295) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.closeEditors(WorkbenchPage.java:1269) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.closeEditor(WorkbenchPage.java:1333) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorManager.removeExtension(EditorManager.java:1586) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.registry.UIExtensionTracker$1.run(UIExtensionTracker.java:46)
In other words, it is not possible to close editor (this method called form EditorManager.removeExtension implementation) because the bundle was already uninstalled.
If I try to close editor before uninstalling the bundle, following exception occur on trying to exit workbench:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.InvalidRegistryObjectException: Invalid registry object at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.TemporaryObjectManager.getObject(TemporaryObjectManager.java:98) at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ConfigurationElementHandle.getConfigurationElement(ConfigurationElementHandle.java:26) at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ConfigurationElementHandle.getAttribute(ConfigurationElementHandle.java:34) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.registry.EditorDescriptor.getId(EditorDescriptor.java:260) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorHistoryItem.saveState(EditorHistoryItem.java:225) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorHistory.saveState(EditorHistory.java:152) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.saveState(Workbench.java:1953)
The reason: IEditorPart instance passed into EditorManager.removeExtension() in this case has no IEditorInput (null returned from editor.getEditorInput() call) as a result, corresponding IEditorInput will not be removed from EditorHistory on attempt to uninstall bundle with Editor and Workbench fails on saving the state.
Shouldn't we remove EditorHistoryItem from EditorHistory on closing corresponding editor to get rid of these problems?

Created bug 154765 and bug 154767 in Platform/UI to track problems on our side.
Moving this one to GMF since DiagramActionBarContributor.dispose should not access the runtime registry.
Changing component.
Created an attachment (id=48873) Fixes all problems found while editor plugin uninstallation

In addition attached patch contains correction for StorageEditorInputProxy.equals() method. This modification important for correct comparison of different EditorInputs in EditorHistory.remove(input) method. EditorHistory.fifoList contains EditorHistoryItems referencing original editorInputs, as parameter of this method StorageEditorInputProxy proxying original editorInput will be passed.
Is there any chance to commit these fixes to HEAD branch ASAP? We have a problems running whole set of unit-tests for HEAD without this patch.

Found a workaround for this problem: using FileEditorInput returning null from getPersistable() for tests.
So, this problem is not so urgent anymore.

Can I commit the patch without the fix to StorageEditorInputProxy? Since you found a workaround and it's been decided to get rid of proxied editor inputs, the issue with StorageEditorInput not being equal to StorageEditorInputProxy will be resolved.

I think, fixing StorageEditorInputProxy is important wor all the clients of this API. Since generated code not using it anymore, it's up to you to decide if you'd like to improve existing API and fix problems there or not.
Fix committed to head. The fix wasn't exactly the same as patch due to the fact that contribution providers need to provide dispose operation although the plugin they belong to is unloaded.

bug.short_desc: org.eclipse.tptp.platform.profile.server.wst should not require org.eclipse.jst.server.tomcat.* plugin

long_desc.thetext: plugins org.eclipse.jst.server.tomcat.* were required by TomcatDelegate which is obsoleted code and both resources should be removed from the plugin. Feature file should also be updated.

Our product does not wish to include the Tomcat plugins but we do need this feature to profile our proprietary server. Currently, we include this feature and it works but, when our customers attempt to use Eclipse update manager to install 3rd party plugins (e.g. Maven 2), the consistency check fails since the WTP Tomcat plugins are not available.

Agreed. The plugins at least have an optional dependancy on several WTP plugins, but the feature forces a dependancy. This is inconsistent, and even if the plugin dependancies on jst.server.* (Tomcat or generic server framework, either or both won't exist in WTP adopter products) can't be removed, then the feature should at least be fixed.
Could this fix be included in TPTP 4.2.1?
I will raise this for Project lead and PG approval to be included in TPTP 4.2.1

bug.short_desc: Select Tasks screen of the new server wizard should be improved

long_desc.thetext:
During the WTP 1.5 adoption testing we have noticed a difference between 1.0.x and 1.5 on the Select Tasks screen of the new server wizard. It looks like the task's description text is no longer disabled while the task's checkbox label is still disabled. This looks rather odd since the checkbox looks like a parent ui element and typically disabling parent ui elements should disable children. Will attach a screen shot.
Something should be done to improve this screen. Either we should return to disabling the descriptions or some different ui should be created to better represent task list where some tasks cannot be deselected.
Created an attachment (id=48418) Screen Shot

This change was due to bug 132758, also from BEA. :) We can't do much in 1.5.1 due to UI freeze. Do you want me to revert to the old behaviour, or do you have another suggestion for minor UI improvement?

Funny how that happens. :)
A quick way to improve this without just reverting the 132758 change would be to set the checkbox label to an empty string and use a separate label control. This way the label can stay enabled while the checkbox is selected/disabled. There could be an issue with accessability in doing that. Don't know enough about that to know for sure. If something like that is not possible, I think reverting the 132758 fix would be better than the current behavior.

AFAIK, using the separate label would be an accessibility problem - screen readers would not read the associated label text when someone selects the checkbox. Do you want to check with Thomas about reverting the other fix, or should I just go ahead?
Go ahead with the revert. Thomas is no longer with BEA.
Ok, will do. Change checked into HEAD.
Thanks!
Released to 1.5.1 and 2.0 streams.
This is part of a "mass update" where bugs showing "fixed" between 7/1/2006 and 9/27/2006 are assumed fixed in WTP 1.5.1. feel free to change the target milestone if you know a more accurate setting.
Closing as resolved since 1.5.1. If this bug should not be closed, please reopen.

bug.short_desc: Callisto Updates Don't Go to Specified Extension Location (Except First One)

long_desc.thetext: I got updates for a new install on Eclipse 3.2 from Callisto. I checked several and choose another extension location, c:\eclipsePlugins. Only the first went to that location. The others went to c:\eclipse.

Well, the interest in this is underwhelming. Now, several months later, I see the problem is probably that choosing another extension location probably applies to the (sort of) selected item rather than to all the items as it seemed to me. This is just a case of bad interface design. It could say choose another location for the *selected* item, and to be really nice could have an item for apply to all. This is somewhat important as Callisto is becoming popular, and installing multiple items will become common.
In any event, it is easily misinterpreted as is.
(BTW I have not checked this conjecture. It took me 3 days to upgrade to 3.2 from 3.1 and a similar amount of time for 3.0 to 3.1. This is a problem in itself. It is working now and I don't have more time to play with it.)
In any event, it is very time consuming to disable, uninstall, then reinstall these items one by one. The update manager is good idea, but the user interface implementation leaves something to be desired. This is just one of many problems I've had.

Agreed that Update Manager has issues.
As for updating across major releases (3.0->3.1 etc), that is not something we generally support (unfortunately). The root files (launcher, startup.jar) are not updatable out of the box and there are a few other issues. There are a few plan items and activities around improving this support in 3.3 but it is unclear if the complete stroy will be in place by then.

Thanks for the response. From experience it appears upgrading across major releases is best done by starting from scratch. That is what I ended up doing for 3.1 -> 3.2. But that can be time consuming trying to get back where you were. It's best to keep good notes.
BTW the 3.2.0 -> 3.2.1 worked easily for me via the Update manager. Only one problem with an error message that kept *everything* from updating. (The error message was from an *unrelated* plug-in that had a missing dependency. I had to disable that plug-in to get any of the updates to install, even though they have nothing to do with that plug-in.)
BTW this bug was just about the one small problem related to using a different location for all of the Callisto installs. I think that could be fixed by a UI that makes it clear that you have to specify the different location for each and every one of the installs and perhaps providing an option to apply to all.

This seems to be fixed. I don't know when it happened, but my current 3.2.1 version has a very nice dialog with a table showing the installation locations for each to-be-installed component. You can select them all and do one change location or whatever you want. IMHO the options are clear and obvious -- as opposed to the old one. I would consider this problem fixed (even though it apparently did not result from this bug). Thanks,
-Ken
